title: Leicester - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Alice Jackson
is a sustainability professional working from the University of Leicester directly with businesses in Leicestershire to provide sustainability support, including as an accredited Carbon Literacy Facilitator. She is particularly passionate about using University expertise to support businesses in all areas of sustainability.
About Us
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Harborough Innovation Centre, Leicester Road,
Market Harborough,
LE16 7WB
UK

title: GreenTech South West
description:
Green Tech South West presents an online event where we'll hear from Julien Nioche, Green Software Advocate and Director at Digital Pebble.

Green Ops in Practice: Tools, Data, and Culture for Sustainable Cloud

Cloud computing is a major energy consumer, yet most organisations still lack the visibility and tools needed to accurately quantify—let alone reduce—their environmental impact. This talk dives into the real-world challenges of tackling cloud emissions, starting with the incomplete, often inaccurate, and rarely actionable data provided by the cloud providers.

We'll explore the current landscape of commercial solutions, share how we partnered with one based in our region to help a leading Bristol-based organisation cut their cloud emissions, and discuss how these tools compare in practice.

Along the way, we'll introduce key concepts, offer practical tips, and dig into some of the toughest hurdles—from navigating imperfect data to convincing internal stakeholders, all grounded in my own experience as a developer. We'll also touch on a topic that everybody is expecting: how to estimate the carbon impact of AI workloads and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS).

Finally, we’ll explore the growing ecosystem of open source tools, and how they can empower individuals across an organisation to take initiative, influence decision-making, and foster a culture of sustainability.
location: online

title: Barcelona - Small99's People, Planet, Pint™: Sustainability Meetup
description:
Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
Venue: Bar La Querida
[English below]
¿Te interesa la sostenibilidad? ¿Quieres conocer y hablar con otra gente interesada en ella? Acércate al próximo People, Planet, Pint y podrás crear nuevas conexiones con gente a la que también le preocupa cuidar del planeta.
No hay agenda, no es un taller ni una charla. Simplemente nos juntamos para tomar algo una vez al mes y conectamos con otras personas a las que les interesa la sostenibilidad, intercambiamos ideas, creamos nuevas conexiones o comentamos temas de actualidad. ¡Dejamos que la conversación y la tarde nos lleven adonde quieran!
Todos impactamos el medio ambiente de una manera u otra, así que ven y aprende cómo puedes tomar acción para un futuro más sostenible en tu comunidad.
Al fin y al cabo, para crear un futuro sostenible necesitamos comunidades unidas y conectadas entre ellas, y ¿qué mejor manera de conectar que tomando algo? Las primeras 10 personas tienen bebida gratis, cortesía de nuestro sponsor :)
//

Your Volunteer Hosts
Silvia de la Cruz
Silvia is a sustainability strategist and seasoned ecommerce professional with a passion for making a positive impact. She's focused on helping companies effectively communicate and market their sustainability initiatives to drive meaningful change. She loves the ocean, sharks and whales particularly, and does scuba and freediving when she can.
Ash Woodhall
made Catalonia his home in 2018, moving from Sheffield, England after a year of travel in Latin America. He is defined by his warm heart, friendly approach to life, and occasional sense of dark British humour.
Ash enjoys co-hosting the Barcelona People Planet Pint event so he can learn and meet people with similar interests. For work, he runs a micro-company,
Practical Infosec
, supporting positive-impact organisations by helping them stay safe online.
For fun, you can find him pretending to be a coffee barista at home, writing his personal blog, watching Liverpool FC (usually not) win the league, trying to run his first half-marathon, or getting his ass kicked at chess.
Jo-Anne Godden
Jo is a circularity expert committed to positive change to the textile industry. She has purposefully led
RubyMoon
, a sustainable fashion company whilst investigating textile recycling & helping women entrepreneurs. Originally from Brighton, Jo has launched RubyLab in Barcelona: dedicated to circular textile innovation. Jo loves sea swimming and also organises year-round "Full Moon Swims."

title: The ESG Exhibition
description:
"Morning or Afternoon Sessions Available (Or you can join for the whole day!)

Join us for a half-day event focused on practical strategies to drive sustainable, ethical, and responsible sourcing across industries.

Starting with networking opportunity at 9:30am with our first presentation kicking off for 10am. 

At SMI, our ESG journey is well underway and we’re excited to invite you behind the scenes. This is your chance to learn how it all began, explore our innovative EcoRockwear™ product range, and see the latest sustainable solutions from our core supply partners including Rock Fall, Traffi Glove, Fentex, Midland Paper, LEO Workwear, V12, Bollé, Climate Partner, and more.

What to Expect:
Inspiring Presentations: Hear from our CEO and Head of ESG as they deep-dive into SMI’s sustainable growth strategy, ESG commitments, and how we’re delivering on our three ESG pillars.

Hands-On Product Exploration: Discover the latest in sustainable PPE, packaging, and cleaning solutions from industry-leading suppliers all tailored to your sector’s needs.

Collaborative Roundtables: Sit down face-to-face with our CEO, Commercial Director, ESG team, and Product Design leads. Workshop ideas with fellow attendees and explore actionable steps toward a more sustainable future.

Supply Chain Transparency in Action: See how SMI is building more transparent, ethical, and environmentally sound supply chains and how you can do the same.

Who Should Attend?
Procurement professionals, sustainability leaders, health & safety managers, operations teams, and anyone passionate about making a measurable ESG impact within their organisation.

Spaces are limited — choose a morning or afternoon session and register today!

Event finishes at 4:30pm. "
location:
BMA House, Tavistock Square,
London WC1H 9JP,
UK
organizer: SMI INT Group UK - Elizabeth Mellor Head of ESG

Your Volunteer Hosts
Pippa and Joe live in the Melton-Oakham with their two boys, two cats and 8 chickens. At home they are retrofitting, insulating, re-using materials and wasting as little as possible in what may well be their forever home. Joe loves cycling round Rutland, Charnwood and the Vale of Belvoir, Pippa loves upcycling furniture and creating home-made gifts on her sewing-machine. Pippa and Joe care about the sustainable legacy that will be left to future generations so took the decision to join a carbon reduction & procurement consultancy network in their working lives. They are hoping that Planet, People, Pint in Oakham and Melton will do another little bit to join up people interested in sustainability and keep the momentum to Net Zero going. Please come along and join the conversation!

title: Home Energy Fair
description:
See how your neighbours are cutting their energy bills & find a contractor to make it happen.

Join Retrofit West at the Home Energy Fair, a one-day event connecting homeowners with the latest in energy-efficient home improvements.

How could you improve the comfort of your home and reduce energy bills while undertaking other renovations, such as installing a new kitchen? If you're looking to upgrade your home, this event is for you!

Why Attend?
Learn about energy-efficient upgrades and connect with trusted suppliers.
Network with industry experts and discover innovative solutions for your home.
Find out how to reduce energy bills while enhancing comfort during home renovations.
Explore practical upgrades that improve efficiency and create a healthier, more comfortable living space.
The event includes talks and product demonstrations, showcasing the latest in heat pumps, building fabric solutions, solar panels, and more.

Don’t miss this chance to gain insights, make connections, and take the next step toward a more comfortable, energy-efficient home!

This event is funded by West of England Mayoral Combined Authority and Retrofit West. Thank you to Future Leap for event managing this event.

Retrofit West's mission is to support homeowners across the West of England to accelerate the move to low-carbon housing and building retrofit. They firmly believe that retrofitting is not just a solution; it’s a critical weapon in the battle against climate change. The impact is wide-ranging, spanning across our community, from slashing carbon emissions to enhancing energy efficiency, from boosting local employment opportunities to elevating the health and overall well-being of our residents.
location:
Widcombe Social Club, Lower,
Widcombe Hill,
Bath BA2 6AA,
UK

title: Get your sustainability projects moving again – the top five roadblocks to progress and what to do about them
description:
If you have a sustainability agenda that you want to take action on, but are finding it difficult to get others on board, then this webinar is for you!

Join award-winning climate change coach and author Charly Cox to find out the 5 most common psychological roadblocks to implementing the green transition. In this practical session, Charly will share with you the hidden emotional reasons that people resist the changes you want to make and what you can do to tackle each one. You'll come away with a new perspective on change and some tools that you can immediately test out.

The free webinar will be running live on 3 dates

Tuesday 9th September 10:00–10:45am (BST)
Wednesday 24th September 12:00–12:45pm (BST)
Wednesday 8th October 3:00–3:45pm (BST)
location: online

Your Volunteer Hosts
Alex Duggan
-
REHSQ Ltd
. is an independent Health & Safety and Sustainability Consultancy based in Newbury. They work across a range of diverse industries including trades, manufacturing, commercial, biotech and construction providing a wide range of services. REHSQ are experienced in conducting risk assessments, developing policies and procedures, and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards. REHSQ also specialises in helping businesses integrate environmental, social, and economic sustainability practices into their operations. They are committed to creating a positive impact by guiding clients towards more responsible and resilient business practices and achieving the goal of net zero.
Jim Holland
-
carma
. Jim spent 13 years as a weapons engineer in the Royal Navy before moving into high-level positions in the corporate sector. After losing his job at Manchester Airport Group due to the pandemic, he decided to start his own company. His business focuses on assisting veterans transitioning to civilian life and promoting environmental sustainability, two issues close to his heart. Jim understands the challenges former military personnel face and is dedicated to using his experience to help others navigate this change. He resides in Newbury, Berkshire, with his wife Sally and their four daughters, enjoying the bustle of a big family. Through his work and home life, Jim is passionate about providing support and making a positive impact in the community.

title: Sustainability Unlocked: KEY ESG's Q3 2025 Summit
description:
"We’re excited to announce our Q3 in-person summit, Sustainability Unlocked, taking place on Thursday 11 September 2025 in London.

This half-day event will bring together sustainability, finance, compliance and risk professionals from across our community to explore the evolving impact of regulatory, commercial and reputational drivers on ESG and risk data.

Expect insightful panels, practical case studies, and plenty of networking. Whether you're navigating IFRS S1 and S2 disclosures, value chain reporting, or aligning risk and sustainability teams, this summit is designed to equip you with knowledge and connections that unlock real progress.

Spaces are limited, so we recommend securing your place soon."
location:
Central London, Central London,
London WC2N 5DU,
UK

title: ICSD 2025 : 13th International Conference on Sustainable Development, 10 - 11 September Rome, Italy
description:
European Center of Sustainable Development in collaboration with Canadian Institute of Technology will organize the 13th ICSD 2025 International Conference on Sustainable Development, with particular focus on Environmental, Economic and Socio-Cultural Sustainability.

The Conference theme : Creating a unified foundation for the Sustainable Development: Research, Practice and Education.

The 13th ICSD 2025 will be an excellent opportunity to share your ideas and research findings relevant to the Sustainability Science, through the European network of academics.

This ambition will proceed in a multidisciplinary way across the various fields and perspectives, through which we can address the fundamental and related questions of Sustainable Development.

Unsplash
location:
Roma Eventi, Piazza della Pilotta,
4,
00187 Roma RM,
Italy

title: Sustainability Career Clarity: Set an aligned, confident direction in a changing world
description:
"Finding direction in your sustainability career can be a challenging task; the stakes feel high, and the landscape is shifting fast. 

When you're driven by purpose and a desire to make a real impact , the pressure to “get it right” can be overwhelming.

If you are craving more meaning or momentum, yet feel stuck, uncertain, or stretched too thin to step back and gain clarity, this three-hour workshop will offer you the space, structure and support to move forward with confidence, focus, and purpose.

Through a mix of guided reflection, practical tools and expert insight, you’ll step out of the day-to-day grind and reconnect with what energises you. Whether you’re navigating a crossroads or simply ready to realign your path, this workshop will help you set a course for a career direction that feels both impactful and sustainable.

What you'll learn
In this interactive workshop, Claire will guide you to create a clear and energising direction for your sustainability career, one that aligns with your values and enables your greatest impact. You’ll discover:

A simple framework to support confident career decisions

Tools to clarify what truly motivates and sustains you

Practical steps for navigating your career in a fast-changing sustainability landscape

You'll come away:

Clearer on where you can make the biggest difference

More energised and confident in your next steps

Ready to communicate your unique value to employers and collaborators

Who is this for?
This workshop is for sustainability professionals at any career stage who feel unclear, stuck, or uncertain about their next career move. If you’ve ever felt torn between options, unsure how to have the biggest impact, or frustrated by the lack of time and clarity to plan your next steps, this session is for you!"
location: online

title: Navigating CSRD: What's Changing and How to Prepare
description:
WEBINAR DETAILS

Join us for an engaging and informative webinar as we explore the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD), the soon-to-be mandatory framework that’s set to reshape how organisations report on their environmental performance. 

In this session, we’ll break down what CSRD really means for you, what the environmental reporting requirements actually involve, and how you can start getting ready. We’ll also share how Tunley can support you at every step of the journey. From this webinar, you can expect to:

1. Gain a clear understanding of CSRD and its environmental reporting requirements
2. Explore the five ESRS environmental standards (E1–E5) in practical terms
3. Understand the purpose and process of the Double Materiality Assessment
4. Learn how to begin your CSRD journey and plan for compliance
5. Discover how Tunley can support your organisation from the early stages.
location: online

Your Volunteer Hosts
Claire Zwozny-Bestwick
: I'm often introduced as my business name ‘CRZyBest’ and that's great, because I am Claire R. Zwozny-Bestwick. I’m a non-traditional, eco-friendly Silversmith & Sculptor, working from my CRZyBest Shedquarters in Derby, creating tiny sculptures in metal clay and turning them into jewellery and accessories. Ensuring our world is a happy place is really important to me, so when making CRZyBest creations I always try my best to look after my customers and our planet too, which is why I make every effort to source my energy, tools and materials from sustainable and ethical sources. Before starting my business, I was a teacher for 20 years and I still very much enjoy supporting others in their businesses, creativity and sustainability journey. I’m a massive advocate of collaboration over competition and my favourite things to make are inspired by dogs and beer, so when I’m not creating in my Shedquarters, you can find me walking my dog or sharing stories with people in my favourite pub, so what better next step than to start hosting ‘People, Planet, Pint’ in The Flowerpot!

Paul Haslam
is passionate about helping to protect the planet’s climate and biodiversity for generations to come. He is the Climate Change Champion for North Yorkshire Council (and NYC councillor for Bilton and Nidd Gorge), and understands the significant impact that SMEs can deliver in this challenge.
Paul is an ESG coach to businesses, helping senior executives understand the implications of ESG reporting and the opportunity of the circular economy in their sector, which then allows them to formulate their own ESG strategy that eventually becomes part of business as usual. As a former FTSE 250 CEO, Paul knows that a business cannot be sustainable without making a profit but highlights the importance of understanding that a business cannot thrive without looking after its people and the planet where much of its resources come from.

title: Make the Most of Your New York Climate Week
description:
🎉Join us on 12th September 12pm-1pm BST for: 

“Make the Most of Your New York Climate Week” – a lively, practical session to help you thrive, not just survive! 🌍✨

Planning to dive into events this New York Climate Week? We’ll help you do it with purpose, positivity, and zero burnout.

🧭Learn how to:

→Choose sessions that inspire, connect, and energise
→Set clear goals so you actually get what you came for
→Tame FOMO and dodge overwhelm
→Keep your energy high and conversations upbeat

💡PLUS: Get our free Action Catcher tool — a simple doc to help you reflect, follow up, and turn insight into impact.

Perfect for changemakers, sustainability pros, and curious minds who want to walk away with clarity, connections, and a real sense of momentum.

Let’s make this Climate Week count — and feel good doing it. 💥



What people say about our workshops:

“I already can see that it's working like magic. I have already made progress in projects that were ""Never going to happen"" in the past.”

“I am astonished at how some simple questions and space for reflection change my mindset.”

“Great frameworks to help nudge different thinking. Very helpful practical takeaways. Thank you!”


Note: if you can't make the session, a recording will be available for those who register.
location: online

title: Winchester - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Kay Mitchell
Lucy Potashnick
Winchester Action on the Climate Crisis (WinACC) is a registered charity working tirelessly with communities and organisations across the Winchester district to fight climate change. We are working for a healthy and sustainable Winchester district to ensure a more constructive and sustainable future.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Winchester School of Art, Park Ave,
Winchester SO23 8DJ,
UK

The Homestead café actively supports circular economy practices. Come to see what they're up to. They also make very lovely pizzas and we'll be offered a slice or two, as well as discounted drinks.

Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink?
Your Volunteer Hosts
Anne Barrett
started
Climate Confidence
to help small business owners feel empowered about combating climate change. She uses the Small99 Action Box, Carbon Reduction Fundamentals to help business teams develop an action plan for carbon reductions. She is also a Fresk facilitator, running workshops to help with understanding the causes and effects of climate change, also with the outcome of a plan for reducing carbon emissions. She’s proud to live in the London Borough of Lewisham.
Elodie Baran
strives to make a meaningful impact by encouraging sustainable living and raising awareness of human activity's effect on the planet, after having dedicated 25 years to the hospitality industry. She is passionate about fostering collaboration, mentoring others, and advocating for a more sustainable and compassionate future. As a facilitator of the Circular Economy Collage Workshop, Elodie works to raise awareness of the climate crisis, emphasising resource reuse and waste reduction. She is also a community gardener, deeply committed to reconnecting people with nature. Originally from France, Elodie has been based in London for over a decade, after 11 years in Costa Rica.

People Planet Pastry
’! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability.
Your Volunteer Hosts
Maria Huff has lived in & around Banbury for over 20 years, variously involved in Quakers, Friends of the Earth, Community Action Groups, Extinction Rebellion and the Banbury Acting Together network during that time - and loves having supportive and positive conversations about sustainability, and how we as people need to find our way to it. She's an IT Manager by profession, with a love of fixing and recycling things.
Venue Accessibility
Accessibility: There is one step in the main entrance to the White Horse. There is step free access via the side lane (on the left as you look from the road), and a back gate on your right. Disabled parking right outside the pub.
Food: there is no food served at the White Horse at the moment, you can bring your own, or order food in if you want.
Our Sponsor
KRYSTAL
are an award-winning, 100% renewably powered web hosting provider, with datacentres in the UK, US, & Europe. They are climate positive, and their approach centres on value, quality and transparency.

title: Nottingham - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
Location: Library at Broadway cinema
The Broadway cinema is an iconic presence at the heart of Nottingham’s cultural quarter - in Hockley. To find it
follow this link
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about sustainability, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Hosts
Fred Paterson
has been supporting small businesses on their sustainability journeys for more than a decade, in his role as Associate Professor for Sustainable Business at Derby University, in setting up the Low Carbon Business Network and as Founder of
Accelerate the Shift
. At these informal events, Fred will help small business leaders navigate the increasingly crowded market of 'net zero’ support and resources. He is also a big fan of pastries, so working with Small99 to launch People, Planet, Pastry in Nottingham is a match made in heaven. We look forward to hearing about your sustainability journey at a People, Planet Pastry session near you, very soon.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
are our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Broadway Café Bar, 14-18 Broad St,
Nottingham NG1 3AL,
UK

A recent addition to the Edinburgh Innovations, Student Enterprise team,
Constanza
brings extensive experience in regenerative business and supply chain. With an MSc in Sustainable Resource Management from Edinburgh University, she has dedicated her career to helping organisations become more sustainable. Formerly the Regenerative Business Team Leader at Ooni, she played a pivotal role in embedding regenerative business while spreading the joy of pizza globally. Recognized on the Scottish Power COP26 Green Power List as one of the UK’s green champions helping fight climate change, Constanza believes in the power of organisations and communities to drive change towards a regenerative future.
Tom is a climate educator, event manager and social psychology student. He facilitates climate education workshop Climate Fresk, and over the past few years he has been involved in local projects such as the Edinburgh Climate Festival. Tom's daily job is in event management, and for the last 2 years he combined this with event & corporate sustainability, helping clients and organisers to improve their events' environmental impact. Outside of work, Tom studies Social Psychology, loves cycling, public transport and veggie food.
Leonardo Binetti, PhD, is the CTO and co-founder of AraBat, the most awarded green/deep tech sustainable startup that recycles lithium-ion batteries using food waste. He is on Plastic Free Certification's quality board and an ex-lecturer in Environmental Engineering at Edinburgh Napier University.

and works closely with Clean Growth UK and our local authorities on business transition to net zero. Connect with him on
LinkedIn.
Ed Chinn
I'm focused on creating a positive impact through my work, for the wider community and (as much as possible) the planet. Essentially, leaving the world in a better place than I found it. I look to do this connecting people, ideas and insights via groups like People, Planet, Pint! as well as LinkedIn and Twitter. I’m a keen advocate of positive action through innovation, conscious capitalism and building a more circular economy. Via a range of sources, including fellowship of the RSA and podcasts (I highly recommend John Richardson and the Futurenauts!) to name a couple, I am passionate about educating myself about how I can be a better citizen and ancestor.

founded and run the 'B Corp Academy Warwickshire'. This online course offers great value and supports small cohorts of businesses through the B Corp application process with ease and confidence. As well as working together to advance the profile and success of B Corps within Warwickshire and the Midlands, Alison and Laura each run their own businesses, working as independent advisers on sustainability and ESG.
Ashlea
has been living in Stratford on a narrowboat & supporting SME's on their own unique sustainability journey on behalf of Stratford College, working with the likes of The Farm Stratford, Launch Agency, Net Zero Stratford and more since September 2022, before moving on to UCB as their newly appointed Sustainability Manager. Ashlea has strong ties to the water & land, having worked on farms & boats most of her life, delivering events & training support across a variety of areas and for varied audiences She is also part of the organising committee for The Great Big Green Week in Stratford, is currently working with BEC Leaps (and fellow PPP Host for Birmingham, Maddie Booth) to deliver a Sustainability Manager short course & is a co-host for PPP Leamington Spa.

title: The HEAT
description:
THE HEAT: CELEBRATING INNOVATION THAT’S GOOD FOR THE PLANET

Brought to you by the VOYAGERS Climate-Tech community, THE HEAT is a hands-on, practical, mind-expanding, friendship-building, exploratory, curiosity-led, science-based, creative, artistic, participatory, decentralised, experimental, edgy, live, risky, urgent and unpredictable gathering of 600+ talented people working on climate technologies.

THE HEAT is not a conference. Don’t expect dull panels or crappy coffee. Climate change is too urgent a problem to waste time. Instead, we designed it to help participants make new friends, to experience science in action, to learn and share their knowledge, to inspire and be inspired. Bring your most engaged and curious festival mindset. At THE HEAT 2024, festival-goers met nuclear-fusion startups, tasted future foods, witnessed carbon capture, experienced climate-robotics demonstrations… and enjoyed a climate-film festival, music performances and a startup pitch contest.
location:
Harwell Science and Innovation Campus, Rutherford Avenue,
Harwell,
Campus,
Didcot OX11 0GD,
UK

title: Become a People Planet Pint Host!
description:
What does Hosting a People Planet Pint mean? Explore the ways you can get involved and host a much loved event series in this webinar
In this informative session, you will learn about the mission and vision of People Planet Pint, our achievements so far, and how you can benefit from becoming a host. We will discuss the various hosting opportunities available, the impact your support can have on our community initiatives, and the mutual benefits of this partnership.
Key Topics Covered:
Introduction to People Planet Pint: Our story, mission, and values.
The impact of our community initiatives on a local and global level
Sponsorship opportunities: Different levels of sponsorship and the benefits associated with each.
Q&A session: Get all your questions answered by our team and make an informed decision about joining us as a host.
Why Host People Planet Pint?
People Planet Pint
(PPP)
is more than just a series of informal meetups—it's a growing, vibrant
national network of sustainability-minded professionals, entrepreneurs, and changemakers
.
With over 100 active locations across the UK and beyond, PPP brings together individuals who care deeply about creating a better future for people and the planet.
1.
Authentic Brand Alignment with Sustainability
Our attendees aren't just passive listeners—they are
action-oriented individuals
working in sustainability, community organisations, clean tech, ethical business, and climate policy.
Your support places you
at the heart of real climate conversations
happening in local pubs, co-working spaces, and community hubs across the country.
2.
Engage With a High-Quality, Values-Driven Audience
Our community includes:
Sustainability professionals
Small business owners
Innovators and startup founders
Local government and NGO representatives
Sponsors get access to this
valuable, engaged, and passionate network
—a unique blend of grassroots and professional spheres.
3.
Hyperlocal and Scalable Reach
With events happening regularly in dozens of cities and towns, you have local impact and are part of an international movement of change.
4.
Positive Brand Visibility—Without the Greenwash
Unlike traditional event sponsorships, PPP is intentionally
non-corporate and community-led
, creating a trusted environment where you are a supportive partner through grass roots organisations. This builds long-term trust and awareness
location:
1 Mill Street | Coworking Space, 1 Mill St,
Royal Leamington Spa,
Leamington Spa CV31 1ES,
UK

title: Malvern - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Hosts
Hosted by the Enigma Sustainability Forum – we are a group of like-minded individuals working within the Enigma Business Park and Spring Lane area, who are committed to improving our local environment and supporting each other to reduce our carbon footprint. Come along and meet the team – Clare, Vic, Bex, Oli, Carl and Jim – all working for local businesses.
Clare
works as the Sustainability Project Manager at Malvern Panalytical, working on reducing emissions and improving product sustainability within R&D. She is also involved in the
Malvern Hills Car Club
, lending ebikes out to locals for free trials. Clare can often be spotted around Malvern on her Dutch cargo bike, with her kids in the front seat.
Vic works at Westbridge Food Group, a global food importer, as the Responsible Sourcing Officer, involved in sustainability programmes and collaborations with industry groups to increase our impact on emissions reductions. As our head office is in Malvern, we are keen to support our local community and looking forward to meeting like-minded people and chatting about everyone’s net zero journeys.
Bex works as the Sustainability Coordinator for Smartbox Assistive Technology, a global leader in augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) technology. Working collaboratively across teams to measure and manage ongoing sustainability reporting, which helps focus on key sustainability initiatives. Often seen volunteering with Malvern Community Forest, a Malvern charity who aim to improve the biodiversity of community woodland and get people into green spaces.
About Us
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Faun @ The Morgan Experience Centre, Spring Ln,
Danes Cl,
Malvern WR14 2LS,
UK

title: Maximising Business Success through Decarbonisation: Technology Expo & Industry Talks
description:
"This free and informative morning event brings together local companies from key sectors including Advanced Manufacturing, Aerospace, Fintech, Quantum, and AI to explore practical ways to cut costs, improve energy efficiency, and build long-term resilience.

Focusing on energy use and commercial retrofitting, the event will showcase real-world steps businesses can take now to reduce overheads, manage risk, and stay competitive in a changing economy.

You’ll hear from expert speakers and local businesses already making progress, sharing valuable insights and case studies on:

Smarter energy use and how to lower your bills

Building upgrades that improve comfort, reduce waste, and protect against rising energy costs

Accessing funding, advice, and support for energy and retrofit improvements

Preparing your workforce with the green skills needed for future growth

You’ll also have time to connect with exhibitors who are offering solutions such as solar panels, heat pumps, insulation, hydrogen technology, and energy management systems.

Enjoy light breakfast, refreshments and network with other forward-thinking businesses as you explore new tools, funding opportunities, and local partnerships.

This free event is for South Gloucestershire businesses seeking hands-on strategies to improve performance and embrace future-ready practices.

This event is funded and supported by South Gloucestershire Council, in partnership with Future Leap."
location:
Bristol & Bath Science Park, Dirac Cres,
Emersons Green,
Bristol BS16 7FR,
UK

title: ESG Benelux
description:
Legal ESG events around the world offer a unique platform for law firm leaders, general counsel, ESG experts, and legal professionals to exchange insights and help shape the ESG agenda in the legal sector.
We are happy to announce a new ESG event focused on Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg, Legal ESG BENELUX to be held on 24 September 2025, in The Hague (The Netherlands).
At Legal ESG BENELUX we will discuss key themes including regulatory change, political context, talent, litigation, AI, and the evolving role of legal professionals in the ESG space.
The conference will take place on Wednesday, 24 September 2025, and is hosted by the Dutch law firm La Gro in The Hague.
We are currently shaping the programme and reaching out to potential speakers, panelists, and moderators. The preliminary list of topics includes (subject to refinement in close coordination with speakers):
Global Shifts: Trump 2.0, Geopolitics, Risk & Regulation
Landmark Cases: ESG in the Courtroom
ESG in the Benelux: Regulatory Developments, Litigation Risks, and ESG & Transactions
What Clients Want: ESG Challenges and Expectations Unpacked
B Corp & Beyond: Rethinking Law Firm Values
EU ESG Agenda: Omnibus & Draghi Insights
Wellbeing at Work: The Next ESG Frontier
Biodiversity: The Legal Stakes of Nature Loss
Confirm your place by July 31st and save €300
Register here: https://www.insidepractice.com/legal-esg-benelux-2025
location:
La Gro Den Haag, Pr. Margrietplantsoen 56 WTC,
2595 BR Den Haag,
Netherlands

title: Northampton - Small99's People, Planet, Pint™: Sustainability Meetup
description:
Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
Pop down to your local
People Planet Pint
meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved.
No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s.
Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally.
We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas.
Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink?
Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to ‘
People Planet Pastry
’! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability.
Your Volunteer Hosts
Alexina
launched independent consultancy
ActNow Consulting
in 2022 with the mission to help businesses flourish through adopting positively impactful practices and becoming forces for good. Alexina is a member of
UK for Good
and is working to create a network of Northamptonshire businesses interested in sustainability, ESG and systemic change.
Laura
is the founder of
B Corp Expert
- a consultancy that specialises in helping businesses achieve B Corp Certification/recertification. Laura is a member of
UK For Good
along with Alexina, and is a fan of collaboration and cake!
Our Sponsor
KRYSTAL
are an award-winning, 100% renewably powered web hosting provider, with datacentres in the UK, US, & Europe. They are climate positive, and their approach centres on value, quality and transparency.
We are delighted to announce our partnership with Krystal (the UK's only B Corp web hosting/cloud provider), and welcome them on board as sponsors of the People, Planet, Pint events.
This means
the first 10 drinks
are on Krystal at every event, and has allowed us to invest and upscale the series to accelerate action on climate change.
Simon Blackler
is the founder of
KRYSTAL
, and Co-Founder of
MillionTreePledge
.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
location:
V and B Northampton, 10 St Giles' Square,
Northampton NN1 1DA,
UK

Outside of work, I enjoy the countryside life with my daughter and our dog, Oona. My personal and professional lives are intertwined by a common thread: a commitment to sustainability, making a difference one website at a time.
Anna Rose Bowler
Hi, I'm
Anna
, an ex-geography teacher and current marketeer. I work mostly with charities to help them share news of their wonderful work
.
I've always cared about the planet and the people in it –  and being a human geographer – I have a keen interest in people, and I love to meet new people, learn new things, and make new connections. I believe together we can make a difference. I look forward to welcoming you to PPP.

title: Bournemouth - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Karley Woodford
is the Site Director at Patch Bournemouth, based on the first floor of Bobby’s. Patch is a co-working club with a passion for people, nourishing local communities, reinvigorating high street spaces and embracing a culture of care.
When Karley’s not at Patch, you’ll find her hosting Yoga retreats as part of her side hustle as a Yoga Teacher or exploring the great outdoors with her Spanish rescue pup.
Nick Whitnell
is founder of Daring Works, a Dorset based consultancy and coaching business passionate about nurturing purposeful outcomes to achieve sustainable success.
With an extensive career in corporate marketing, Nick made the decision to leave that world and follow his heart by training with B Corp as a ‘B Leader’ and also as a soulful coach.
Nick is never far from the sea and loves exploring Dorset on his bike.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Patch Bournemouth, Square,
2-12 Commercial Rd,
Bournemouth BH2 5LY,
UK

title: WINS Swansea Meet Up
description:
"Welcome to our very first WINS Meet Up Swansea!

Join us at Urban HQ on September 25, 2025 at 5:00 PM for an evening filled with friendly networking and learning.

You may, or may not, have sustainability in your job title but if you're taking action to make Swansea a greener, healthier and happier place, this is for you!

Hosted by Rhian Sherrington, founder and head coach of the thriving Women in Sustainability Network, you can expect to meet impact-led women from across the city and expand your knowledge. There'll be some light touch facilitation to get you all talking to one another, so expect to come away inspired with some brilliant new connections that support your work or business.

Don't miss this opportunity to grow your circle and gain valuable insights.

The event is free to attend but you do need to register as space is limited and we ask that you buy a drink or two from the Cafe bar to support the venue (wine, beer, alcohol free, tea/ coffee are all available ).

Supported by Urban HQ. Funded by the UK Government through the Shared Prosperity Fund.
location:
Urban HQ, 37 Orchard St,
Swansea SA1 5AJ,
UK

Your Volunteer Hosts
Raechel Kelly
worked in sustainable finance for 12 years, on ESG analysis and fossil fuel divestment. In 2020 she set up
The Liminality
, her small solo project working on climate communications and facilitation. In the same year she approached local charity Vision 21 to set up
Planet Cheltenham
, the town's first community climate solutions hub with the aim of empowering residents around joyful climate action. She now runs several projects including a Youth Climate Group, Little Planet Cheltenham baby group, and took part in the pilot Doughnut Economics Learning Journey as a host to some amazing local renegade economists. She is a NED at Good With Money, an RSA fellow, and you will always find her in the kitchen at parties (asking where the recycling bin is).
Becki Sillence
works for local climate charity
Vision 21
as the communications manager for the
CheltenhamZero
project, a joint initiative between Vision21 and Cheltenham Borough Council supporting local organisations to move towards a Net Zero position. She has worked with a wide range of people and organisations in Cheltenham and has experience in the community, engagement and flood resilience sectors.
Andrew Lansley
is the Innovation Manager for Cheltenham Festivals, Senior Academic at the University of Gloucestershire and facilitator for the Cheltenham Culture Board. He works cross-sector with regional and national stakeholders to help progress the town’s relationship with culture, technology, sustainability and accessibility. Andrew believes culture can play a key role in promoting sustainable economics around Cheltenham, Gloucestershire and the UK, and is involved in numerous related projects across the live events and cultural sectors.

A career of thirty years working within SEND education and a love of all things local gives
Andrew Holland

title: Belfast - People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Hello! I am
Bryony
a business owner and a mum to three and a sausage dog owner. (Ben)I am passionate about change. I wish to leave a legacy for my children, “Our Planet,” and raise climate awareness through conversations.
https://www.thinkpragmatic.uk
About Us
Small99
is a platform that guides small business owners to Net Zero and avoids the overwhelm. Small99 organises the PPP events, with the belief that bringing people together will spark unexpected solutions to collaboration in tackling climate change.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“
We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
2 Royal Avenue, 2 Royal Ave,
Belfast BT1 1DA,
UK

title: Smart ways to run your business: Explore what circular can do for you
description:
Discover how circular thinking can boost sustainability, cut costs, and strengthen your business. Join us to explore practical ways to reduce waste, reuse resources, and create value through local supply chains.

Hear insights from the Universities of Brighton and Sussex, Circular Brighton & Hove, and Restaurants Brighton, with real examples of cost savings, customer loyalty, and improved resilience. Plus, get a first look at Plus X Innovation’s new circularity programme launching this autumn.

Network with like-minded businesses, share ideas, and learn how to take your first—or next—steps toward a circular economy.
location:
Plus X Innovation Brighton, Plus X Innovation,
Lewes Rd,
Brighton and Hove,
Brighton BN2 4GL,
UK

title: Barcelona - Small99's People, Planet, Pint™: Sustainability Meetup
description:
Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
Venue: Bar La Querida
[English below]
¿Te interesa la sostenibilidad? ¿Quieres conocer y hablar con otra gente interesada en ella? Acércate al próximo People, Planet, Pint y podrás crear nuevas conexiones con gente a la que también le preocupa cuidar del planeta.
No hay agenda, no es un taller ni una charla. Simplemente nos juntamos para tomar algo una vez al mes y conectamos con otras personas a las que les interesa la sostenibilidad, intercambiamos ideas, creamos nuevas conexiones o comentamos temas de actualidad. ¡Dejamos que la conversación y la tarde nos lleven adonde quieran!
Todos impactamos el medio ambiente de una manera u otra, así que ven y aprende cómo puedes tomar acción para un futuro más sostenible en tu comunidad.
Al fin y al cabo, para crear un futuro sostenible necesitamos comunidades unidas y conectadas entre ellas, y ¿qué mejor manera de conectar que tomando algo? Las primeras 10 personas tienen bebida gratis, cortesía de nuestro sponsor :)
//

Your Volunteer Hosts
Silvia de la Cruz
Silvia is a sustainability strategist and seasoned ecommerce professional with a passion for making a positive impact. She's focused on helping companies effectively communicate and market their sustainability initiatives to drive meaningful change. She loves the ocean, sharks and whales particularly, and does scuba and freediving when she can.
Ash Woodhall
made Catalonia his home in 2018, moving from Sheffield, England after a year of travel in Latin America. He is defined by his warm heart, friendly approach to life, and occasional sense of dark British humour.
Ash enjoys co-hosting the Barcelona People Planet Pint event so he can learn and meet people with similar interests. For work, he runs a micro-company,
Practical Infosec
, supporting positive-impact organisations by helping them stay safe online.
For fun, you can find him pretending to be a coffee barista at home, writing his personal blog, watching Liverpool FC (usually not) win the league, trying to run his first half-marathon, or getting his ass kicked at chess.
Jo-Anne Godden
Jo is a circularity expert committed to positive change to the textile industry. She has purposefully led
RubyMoon
, a sustainable fashion company whilst investigating textile recycling & helping women entrepreneurs. Originally from Brighton, Jo has launched RubyLab in Barcelona: dedicated to circular textile innovation. Jo loves sea swimming and also organises year-round "Full Moon Swims."

Claire Zwozny-Bestwick
: I'm often introduced as my business name ‘CRZyBest’ and that's great, because I am Claire R. Zwozny-Bestwick. I’m a non-traditional, eco-friendly Silversmith & Sculptor, working from my CRZyBest Shedquarters in Derby, creating tiny sculptures in metal clay and turning them into jewellery and accessories. Ensuring our world is a happy place is really important to me, so when making CRZyBest creations I always try my best to look after my customers and our planet too, which is why I make every effort to source my energy, tools and materials from sustainable and ethical sources. Before starting my business, I was a teacher for 20 years and I still very much enjoy supporting others in their businesses, creativity and sustainability journey. I’m a massive advocate of collaboration over competition and my favourite things to make are inspired by dogs and beer, so when I’m not creating in my Shedquarters, you can find me walking my dog or sharing stories with people in my favourite pub, so what better next step than to start hosting ‘People, Planet, Pint’ in The Flowerpot!

title: Eco Wedding Festival Gloucester
description:
"Dreaming of a wedding day that is full of fun, laughter and a day that has minimal environmental impact? Are you struggling to find suppliers that share your vision and values?
Then you must come to our Eco Wedding Festival on the 5th October at this stunning historical and sustainable venue that is Blackfriars Priory.

 A wedding fair with a twist, our suppliers are specially vetted to make sure that they fit into our ""eco"" criteria. Come and meet our wonderful suppliers, florists, cake makers, celebrants, caterers and much more.  
Follow us on Instagram (@ecoweddingfestivals) as we announce the suppliers in the run up to the event.

Stay for the whole day!  The festival is designed to entertain you for the day:

 - Eco goodie bags for the first 20 people through the door
 - Raffle with fab eco prizes
- Live music all day
- Food and drinks available to purchase and enjoy
- Bridal fashion show
- Workshops (details TBC soon)
- Sustainable honeymoon showcase

HELP US MAKE OUR FESTIVAL EVEN MORE ECO :
Walk, cycle or take the public transport to the festival as the venue is perfectly located in the city centre. Ditch the car if you can, of course.
As a thank you for helping us making a difference this way, we will give you a free raffle ticket to enter our fantastic eco raffle. Just arrive and tell us what mode of transport you used and if applicable, we will treat you with a raffle ticket!"
location:
Blackfriars Priory, Blackfriars Priory,
Ladybellegate St,
Gloucester GL1 2HN,
UK

is passionate about helping to protect the planet’s climate and biodiversity for generations to come. He is the Climate Change Champion for North Yorkshire Council (and NYC councillor for Bilton and Nidd Gorge), and understands the significant impact that SMEs can deliver in this challenge.
Paul is an ESG coach to businesses, helping senior executives understand the implications of ESG reporting and the opportunity of the circular economy in their sector, which then allows them to formulate their own ESG strategy that eventually becomes part of business as usual. carma

After losing his job at Manchester Airport Group due to the pandemic, he decided to start his own company. Jim understands the challenges former military personnel face and is dedicated to using his experience to help others navigate this change. title: Legal ESG: Europe
description:
ESG is moving from voluntary ambition to mandated action.
As Europe rolls out sweeping new regulations – from the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) to the Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CS3D) – businesses face unprecedented obligations to report on sustainability and police their supply chains. At the same time, regulators around the world are ramping up ESG enforcement, and courts are seeing a surge in climate and ESG-related lawsuits.
The question is no longer if companies and their legal advisors should prioritize ESG, but how to do so effectively, in full compliance, and in ways that stand up to scrutiny.
Legal ESG: Europe 2025, taking place on 16th October 2025 at Baker McKenzie’s Paris office, is an opportunity for law firm leaders, in-house counsel, compliance professionals, and ESG experts to come together, learn from each other, and drive the ESG agenda forward. It’s a chance to reflect on the progress made so far, confront the challenges on the horizon, and commit to a future where ESG is a fundamental element of corporate strategy and legal practice. Join us to exchange ideas, prepare for what’s next, and ensure that your organization is ready for this new chapter of ESG.
Discussions Will Include
How will new EU directives like CSRD and CS3D reshape corporate accountability and legal risk?
Are companies prepared to meet stringent ESG reporting requirements and conduct due diligence across global supply chains?
What do rising climate lawsuits and greenwashing crackdowns mean for businesses and their counsel?

Bluestone B2B
, a new business consultancy that helps Agencies, Consultancies and purpose-driven B2B companies to grow their business. We launched with the aim of creating a more productive, remote-working environment, contributing to a lower-carbon business culture, and a more positive employee work-life balance. 10 years on, and we now have an increased focus on people and planet-driven initiatives. Our activities include membership to the Better Business Network, supporting the Better Business Act, carbon footprint offsetting via SKOOT (a B-Corp) and membership to 1% For The Planet. We have a long-standing relationship with Neo, and have supported them over the years with their new business outreach and engagement.
Kelly Smith
co-runs
Neo
, one of the first certified B Corps in the UK and a member of the Better Business Network. Neo was also one of the few original purposeful creative agencies, having dedicated itself from day one to working exclusively on projects with social and environmental purpose.
Through their partnership with Bluestone B2B, the Neo team want to help more sustainable and ethical businesses build their success around positive change.
Kelly’s commitment to purposeful work and love for language is matched only by her passion for beer. title: Bromley - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Angela Hulm
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Greener and Cleaner, High St,
Bromley BR1,
UK

title: Sustainability Europe 2025
description:
In 2025 the corporate sustainability landscape is defined by regulatory uncertainty, unchartered climate risk and geopolitical shocks. The threat of deregulation compounded with the increased scrutiny on the commercial value of sustainability investments translates into real-world impact across complex global supply chains. Sustainability professionals are overrun, facing hurdles in data management, struggling with scalability, and navigating swings in trends.

With only 5 years until 2030, corporations are at a major inflection point. Interpreting unclear regulations, building compelling business cases and managing intricate supply chains effectively while addressing complex data challenges is paramount to future success. Developing a proactive approach and moving beyond compliance-driven reporting will be difficult and cannot be done alone.

Sustainability Europe 2025 offers you a unique opportunity to meet the moment and directly address these challenges. Join 500+ senior corporate executives as we provide practical strategies to navigate regulatory overload, build financially sound sustainability arguments, and drive real action. Through peer-to-peer roundtables, expert panels, and insightful fireside chats, you will gain clarity, create valuable networks, and acquire actionable tools to thrive in this evolving landscape. Attending will give you the tools to drive meaningful, value-creating sustainability strategies within your organisation.

For the past 24 years this, our flagship European event, has outlined the latest trends, tactics and opportunities in sustainable business. Join us at this critical juncture in October as we drive sustainable action and deliver corporate value.
location:
Convene 155 Bishopsgate Liverpool Street, 155 Bishopsgate,
London EC2M 3YD,
UK

title: Become a People Planet Pint Host!
description:
What does Hosting a People Planet Pint mean? Explore the ways you can get involved and host a much loved event series in this webinar
In this informative session, you will learn about the mission and vision of People Planet Pint, our achievements so far, and how you can benefit from becoming a host. We will discuss the various hosting opportunities available, the impact your support can have on our community initiatives, and the mutual benefits of this partnership.
Key Topics Covered:
Introduction to People Planet Pint: Our story, mission, and values.
The impact of our community initiatives on a local and global level
Sponsorship opportunities: Different levels of sponsorship and the benefits associated with each.
Q&A session: Get all your questions answered by our team and make an informed decision about joining us as a host.
Why Host People Planet Pint?
People Planet Pint
(PPP)
is more than just a series of informal meetups—it's a growing, vibrant
national network of sustainability-minded professionals, entrepreneurs, and changemakers
.
With over 100 active locations across the UK and beyond, PPP brings together individuals who care deeply about creating a better future for people and the planet.
1.
Authentic Brand Alignment with Sustainability
Our attendees aren't just passive listeners—they are
action-oriented individuals
working in sustainability, community organisations, clean tech, ethical business, and climate policy.
Your support places you
at the heart of real climate conversations
happening in local pubs, co-working spaces, and community hubs across the country.
2.
Engage With a High-Quality, Values-Driven Audience
Our community includes:
Sustainability professionals
Small business owners
Innovators and startup founders
Local government and NGO representatives
Sponsors get access to this
valuable, engaged, and passionate network
—a unique blend of grassroots and professional spheres.
3.
Hyperlocal and Scalable Reach
With events happening regularly in dozens of cities and towns, you have local impact and are part of an international movement of change.
4.
Positive Brand Visibility—Without the Greenwash
Unlike traditional event sponsorships, PPP is intentionally
non-corporate and community-led
, creating a trusted environment where you are a supportive partner through grass roots organisations. This builds long-term trust and awareness
location:
1 Mill Street | Coworking Space, 1 Mill St,
Royal Leamington Spa,
Leamington Spa CV31 1ES,
UK

title: Bournemouth - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Karley Woodford
is the Site Director at Patch Bournemouth, based on the first floor of Bobby’s. Patch is a co-working club with a passion for people, nourishing local communities, reinvigorating high street spaces and embracing a culture of care.
When Karley’s not at Patch, you’ll find her hosting Yoga retreats as part of her side hustle as a Yoga Teacher or exploring the great outdoors with her Spanish rescue pup.
Nick Whitnell
is founder of Daring Works, a Dorset based consultancy and coaching business passionate about nurturing purposeful outcomes to achieve sustainable success.
With an extensive career in corporate marketing, Nick made the decision to leave that world and follow his heart by training with B Corp as a ‘B Leader’ and also as a soulful coach.
Nick is never far from the sea and loves exploring Dorset on his bike.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Patch Bournemouth, Square,
2-12 Commercial Rd,
Bournemouth BH2 5LY,
UK

Alex Duggan
-
REHSQ Ltd
. is an independent Health & Safety and Sustainability Consultancy based in Newbury. They work across a range of diverse industries including trades, manufacturing, commercial, biotech and construction providing a wide range of services. REHSQ are experienced in conducting risk assessments, developing policies and procedures, and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards. REHSQ also specialises in helping businesses integrate environmental, social, and economic sustainability practices into their operations. They are committed to creating a positive impact by guiding clients towards more responsible and resilient business practices and achieving the goal of net zero.
Jim Holland
-
carma
. Jim spent 13 years as a weapons engineer in the Royal Navy before moving into high-level positions in the corporate sector. After losing his job at Manchester Airport Group due to the pandemic, he decided to start his own company. His business focuses on assisting veterans transitioning to civilian life and promoting environmental sustainability, two issues close to his heart. Jim understands the challenges former military personnel face and is dedicated to using his experience to help others navigate this change. He resides in Newbury, Berkshire, with his wife Sally and their four daughters, enjoying the bustle of a big family. Through his work and home life, Jim is passionate about providing support and making a positive impact in the community.
